topPRs.author: 2-A-M
topPRs.body:
… replies This commit addresses multiple critical bugs discovered during comprehensive testing: **1. Fix infinite auth retry loop (src/base.ts)** - Added error throwing when authentication succeeds but verification fails - Prevents infinite loop when credentials are valid but verification returns false - Preserves existing exponential backoff and 3-retry limit **2. Implement media upload support (5 files)** - src/post.ts: Added media upload via v1.uploadMedia() before posting - src/services/PostService.ts: Added same media upload logic for service layer - src/utils.ts: Added mediaIds parameter to sendTweet() - src/client/client.ts: Added mediaIds parameter to sendTweet() - src/client/tweets.ts: Updated createCreateTweetRequest() to use media_ids - Uses Twitter API v1 for media upload (v2 doesn't support it) - Successfully tested with images and videos **3. Fix mention reply functionality (src/interactions.ts)** - Added check for messageService availability before calling it - Prevents crash when messageService is undefined - Implemented TWITTER_AUTO_RESPOND_MENTIONS setting check - Implemented TWITTER_AUTO_RESPOND_REPLIES setting check - Added logic to distinguish between mentions and replies - Added logging when tweets are skipped due to settings All fixes have been tested and build successfully. ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Tweets can attach uploaded media via stable media IDs. * New AUTO_RESPOND settings to enable/disable auto-replies to mentions and replies. * **Bug Fixes** * Stricter authentication verification during startup to surface failed verifications. * Added safety checks to skip processing when required services are unavailable. * Media upload now logs per-file results and continues on individual failures.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

this PR addresses three critical bugs: authentication retry loops, media upload support, and mention reply handling **key changes:** - **auth fix (src/base.ts):** added error throwing when authentication succeeds but verification fails, preventing infinite retry loops - **media upload (5 files):** implemented media upload using Twitter API v1 (since v2 doesn't support it), uploads media first then passes `mediaIds` to tweet creation - **mention/reply handling (src/interactions.ts):** added `TWITTER_AUTO_RESPOND_MENTIONS` and `TWITTER_AUTO_RESPOND_REPLIES` settings, added `messageService` null check **critical issue found:** - the logic for distinguishing mentions from replies (line 514 in src/interactions.ts) is flawed - it treats any tweet with `inReplyToStatusId` as a "reply to us", even if it's actually a reply to someone else's tweet that mentions the bot. this needs to verify that `inReplyToStatusId` belongs to one of the bot's own tweets

Confidence Score: 3/5

- this PR is mostly safe but contains a logic bug in mention/reply classification that could cause incorrect filtering behavior - the auth fix and media upload implementation are solid, but the mention/reply distinction logic has a critical flaw that will misclassify tweets. the code won't crash but will filter tweets incorrectly based on the AUTO_RESPOND settings - src/interactions.ts requires attention to fix the mention/reply classification logic at line 514

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | src/interactions.ts | added AUTO_RESPOND settings filtering and messageService null check, but mention/reply distinction logic is flawed | | src/base.ts | added error throwing when auth succeeds but verification fails, preventing infinite retry loop | | src/post.ts | implemented media upload using v1 API with proper error handling and logging | | src/services/PostService.ts | implemented media upload using v1 API, consistent with src/post.ts implementation |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client as Client participant Post as Post/PostService participant TwitterV1 as Twitter API v1 participant TwitterV2 as Twitter API v2 Note over Client,TwitterV2: Media Upload Flow Client->>Post: post with mediaData loop for each media file Post->>TwitterV1: uploadMedia(buffer, mimeType) TwitterV1-->>Post: mediaId Post->>Post: collect mediaIds end Post->>TwitterV2: sendTweet(text, replyId, mediaData, false, mediaIds) TwitterV2->>TwitterV2: create tweet with media_ids TwitterV2-->>Post: tweet result Post-->>Client: success ``` Last reviewed commit: f35351a (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
